intro: Cinnamodendron dinisii, commonly known as the Dinis's cinnamodendron, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered yellowish flowers. It produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
